definitions.definition: Capable of producing great physical force.
definitions.example: a big strong man; Jake was tall and strong

definitions.definition: Capable of withstanding great physical force.
definitions.example: a strong foundation; good strong shoes

definitions.definition: (of water, wind, etc.) Having a lot of power.
definitions.example: The man was nearly drowned after a strong undercurrent swept him out to sea.
He is strong in the face of adversity.
a strong light; a strong taste

definitions.definition: Having an offensive or intense odor or flavor.
Having a high concentration of an essential or active ingredient.
definitions.example: a strong cup of coffee; a strong medicine

definitions.definition: (grammar) Inflecting in a different manner than the one called weak, such as Germanic verbs which change vowels.
That completely ionizes into anions and cations in a solution.
definitions.example: a strong acid;  a strong base
You're working with troubled youth in your off time? That’s strong!

definitions.definition: Having a specified number of people or units.
definitions.example: The enemy's army force was five thousand strong.

definitions.definition: (of a disease or symptom) Severe; very bad or intense.
Having a wide range of logical consequences; widely applicable. (Often contrasted with a weak statement which it implies.)
